block.p: With the benefits of Latin America's fastest-growing economy eluding them, thousands of Dominicans pulled the plug on the ruling party in presidential elections. Although Hipolito Mejia, the candidate of the left-center Revolutionary Dominican Party, just missed a majority, he far outpaced his opponents. Facing an insurmountable margin, Danilo Medina of the ruling Dominican Liberation Party declined to pursue a runoff. Mr. Mejia has vowed to increase social spending and help farmers hurt by imports and privatization.

With the benefits of Latin America's fastest-growing economy eluding them, thousands of Dominicans pulled the plug on the ruling party in presidential elections. Although Hipolito Mejia, the candidate of the left-center Revolutionary Dominican Party, just missed a majority, he far outpaced his opponents. Facing an insurmountable margin, Danilo Medina of the ruling Dominican Liberation Party declined to pursue a runoff. Mr. Mejia has vowed to increase social spending and help farmers hurt by imports and privatization.
